title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Terres Blanches Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Still closed and tight, this mineral-textured wine has acidity, a crisp texture and citrus flavors. Fruity now, it will show even more in the future. The wine needs to age, drink from 2020.

title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Blitz Riesling (Mosel)
description: Peachy and plush, this intensely aromatic, concentrated wine offers loads of juicy, forward stone fruit and citrus flavors. Light-bodied, spry and subtly sweet, it's a widely appealing choice at a remarkable price. Drink now.

title: Educated Guess 2015 Merlot (Napa County)
description: With small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this is a reduced and juicy wine, showy in notes of oak and cinnamon. Juicy plum and black cherry provide concentrated fruit flavors alongside a richness of milk chocolate.

title: Ermisch 2015 Erendira's Rise Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine made from a mix of clones is front-loaded with cinnamon and other baking spice accents. There's a broad streak of root beer followed by suggestions of pepper and green herbs.

title: Falkner 2016 Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Clean if rather ripe aromas of peach, bubblegum and banana show on the nose of this bottling, which displays expert restraint from a warm region for an often blousy variety. There's a rich custardy touch at first on the sip, with plumeria and guava flavors, but then the chalky texture reins it back.

title: Familie Steffen 2016 Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Juicy tangerine, lemon and lime abound on this dry, light-bodied Riesling, but earthy, savory herb and mineral notes are prominent as well. It's a brisk, refreshing wine, with a lean, steely finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Goose Ridge 2013 Estate Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Despite being a full four years old, this wine's aromas aren't yet fully revealing their charms, with high-toned vanilla, spice, cedar and cherry notes. The flavors are tightly wound as well, with a light gamy streak throughout. It's not clear if it will open with additional time or if what you see is what you get.

title: Hard Row To Hoe 2014 Tempranillo (Lake Chelan)
description: Blended with 20% Syrah, this brooding wine shows butterscotch, red fruit and spice aromas and tart, high-acid fruit flavors. It's a mix of fruit and barrel characteristics, even though the oak used was neutral. The tannins bring a lightly chalky feel.

title: J. Scott Cellars 2015 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This wine's aromas are upfront, with green pepper, jalapeño and herb notes. The palate is full of dark cherry and herb flavors that show pleasing balance. It's not for all tastes but is sure to please those who enjoy this variety's greener side.

title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2016 Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)
description: This immediately attractive and fruity wine takes its name from the church next to the winery. It is soft with ripe white fruits that are cut by citrus, spice and vanilla flavors. Open and easy, it will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Frenchtown Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Principally Merlot (45%), Cabernet Sauvignon (25%) and Syrah (19%), along with other red varieties, this brings apple, cherry and barrel spice aromas. The flavors are full bodied and liquorous, providing some appeal.

title: Long 2014 Walla Faces Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine's aromas are quite reticent, making one strain to perceive what's in the glass. The palate provides a stark contrast, with bold, lush dark fruit flavors backed by firm tannins. It's a full-bore interpretation of the variety that could move up a notch if the aromas open up.

title: LXV 2016 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Relatively light and delicate on the nose, this bottling shows chalk, ripe pear and the unmistakable aroma of banana-flavored Now & Laters candy. The palate is tightly wound yet tropical, with papaya, mango and ripe peach flavors, each more expressive as the wine warms.

title: Maison Deux-Fleurs 2016  Saint-Véran
description: A ripe and rounded wine, this is rich and full of warm apricot and peach flavors. With refreshing acidity as a contrast, the wine is generous, hinting at spice and vanilla and ready to drink.

title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2016 Closerie des Alisiers Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: Tight tannins proclaim the youth of this wine. With those firm tannins and a dry, solid character, the wine is not yet showing its fruit. Just a hint from the weight of the wine suggests red-cherry flavors will develop. Drink from 2023.

title: Marshall Davis 2015 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This shows exuberant boysenberry, violet, herb, smoked meat and peppery spice aromas, along with a slightly distracting tire rubber note. The palate is packed tightly with rich flavors that carry through the fruit-filled finish. If the tire rubber aromas resolve, it will greatly improve.

title: Mill Creek 2013 Hillside Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is aged entirely in French oak, 75% of it new. Grippy structure surrounds a softened sensibility of dark cherry and chocolate, the oak smoky and tinged in vanilla.

title: Monteci 2016  Valpolicella Classico
description: Red-skinned berry, nutmeg and violet aromas waft out of the glass. Light bodied and savory, it offers red currant, clove and a touch of licorice alongside fresh acidity and rounded tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Monteci 2016  Valpolicella Classico Superiore
description: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice and a hint of black-skinned berry lead the nose while the straightforward palate delivers tobacco, black cherry and a touch of fresh mint. Firm tannins provide support.

title: Napa Cellars 2014 V Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, leathery and earthy in approach and style. Full bodied and extracted in bold brawny black fruit, it offers accents of pencil and wax.

title: Ochoa 2010 Reserva Red (Navarra)
description: Earthy, lightly baked berry aromas fresh on the nose. A snappy palate with raw acidity leads to mildly herbal plum and berry flavors. A dry, spicy, nicely oaked finish is a bit choppy in feel but tastes right. Similar to past bottlings, this is 55% Tempranillo, 30% Cab Sauvignon and 15% Merlot.

title: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut Viognier (Yakima Valley)
description: Brown sugar, flower, pineapple and sugared peach aromas lead to sweet, elegant fruit flavors in this wine. There's some intrigue, but it doesn't all come together.
designation: The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut

title: Patria 2014 Stella di Corleone Catarratto (Sicilia)
description: Unusual scents of brimstone and smoke combine with Mediterranean brush and ripe citrus zest. The aromas carry over to the palate along with a saline note and bright acidity.

title: Pegasus Estate 2016 Rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This pink wine shows plump white peach, watermelon, wet cement and a twist of lime on the nose. There's a flash of sweetness on the sip, with ripe melons, but then it dries up, highlighting rosewater and soft pink-fruit flavors.

title: Penner-Ash 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Production of this cuvée has increased dramatically under the winery's new ownership, making it widely available. It's smooth and balanced, with mixed red fruit flavors cut with an herbal edge. The finish is tart and tight, calling for a hearty decant before serving.

title: Puccioni 2014 Puccioni Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With the addition of 14% Petite Sirah, this delightful old-vine wine is lightly spiced with a taste of black licorice. Vanilla, blackberry and white chocolate add layers of complex, welcomed flavor and succulence to the full-bodied whole.

title: Salvestrin 2014 Cavaso Red (Napa Valley)
description: This full-bodied blend combines a majority of Merlot with Syrah, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Tannic and tight-grained, it's rustic in leather, black cherry and tart soy.

title: Señorío de Sotillo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Black-fruit aromas with accents of road tar and spice turn more herbal with airing. A tight, crisp mouthfeel is built around smacking acidity, while plum and berry flavors come with peppery spice notes. An herbal character returns on a ripped, juicy finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Silvan Ridge 2016 Early Muscat Semi-Sparkling Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: Long a staple of the Silvan Ridge lineup, this lightly fizzy Muscat is off-dry, fresh and aromatic, with orange candy scents and flavors. Serve it as an apéritif with soft cheeses or use it to spiff up your Sunday mimosas or Bellinis.

title: Speri 2014 Sant'Urbano  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore)
description: Aromas of baking spice and black-skinned berry lead the way. The straightforward palate offers vanilla, black-cherry jam and tobacco alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2021.
